bug.author: mansenfranzen
bug.description:
Hi, I just installed pandas_profiling via pip but it fails on import with the following error: <denchmark-code>--------------------------------------------------------------------------- ImportError Traceback (most recent call last) <ipython-input-16-6210451b32fe> in <module> 1 import pandas as pd 2 import altair as alt ----> 3 import pandas_profiling
C:\conda\envs\env_altair\lib\site-packages\pandas_profiling\__init__.py in <module> 16 17 from pandas_profiling.config import config ---> 18 from pandas_profiling.controller import pandas_decorator 19 import pandas_profiling.view.templates as templates 20 from pandas_profiling.model.describe import describe as describe_df
C:\conda\envs\env_altair\lib\site-packages\pandas_profiling\controller\pandas_decorator.py in <module> 1 """This file add the decorator on the DataFrame object.""" 2 from pandas import DataFrame ----> 3 from pandas_profiling.__init__ import ProfileReport 4 5
C:\conda\envs\env_altair\lib\site-packages\pandas_profiling\__init__.py in <module> 18 from pandas_profiling.controller import pandas_decorator 19 import pandas_profiling.view.templates as templates ---> 20 from pandas_profiling.model.describe import describe as describe_df 21 from pandas_profiling.view.notebook import display_notebook_iframe 22 from pandas_profiling.view.report import to_html
C:\conda\envs\env_altair\lib\site-packages\pandas_profiling\model\describe.py in <module> 27 ) 28 from pandas_profiling.utils.common import update ---> 29 from pandas_profiling.view import plot 30 31
C:\conda\envs\env_altair\lib\site-packages\pandas_profiling\view\plot.py in <module> 11 import pandas as pd 12 from matplotlib import pyplot as plt ---> 13 from pandas.plotting import register_matplotlib_converters 14 from pkg_resources import resource_filename 15
ImportError: cannot import name 'register_matplotlib_converters' </denchmark-code>
Here is the pip freeze output: <denchmark-code>astroid==2.2.5 astropy==3.2.1 atomicwrites==1.3.0 attrs==19.1.0 backcall==0.1.0 bleach==3.1.0 certifi==2019.6.16 colorama==0.4.1 confuse==1.0.0 cycler==0.10.0 decorator==4.4.0 defusedxml==0.6.0 entrypoints==0.3 htmlmin==0.1.12 importlib-metadata==0.19 ipykernel==5.1.1 ipython==7.6.1 ipython-genutils==0.2.0 isort==4.3.21 jedi==0.13.3 Jinja2==2.10.1 jsonschema==3.0.1 jupyter-client==5.3.1 jupyter-core==4.5.0 kiwisolver==1.1.0 lazy-object-proxy==1.4.1 llvmlite==0.29.0 MarkupSafe==1.1.1 matplotlib==3.1.1 mccabe==0.6.1 missingno==0.4.2 mistune==0.8.4 mkl-fft==1.0.12 mkl-random==1.0.2 more-itertools==7.2.0 nbconvert==5.5.0 nbformat==4.4.0 numba==0.45.0 numpy==1.16.4 packaging==19.1 pandas==0.23.4 pandas-profiling==2.3.0 pandocfilters==1.4.2 parso==0.5.0 phik==0.9.8 pickleshare==0.7.5 pluggy==0.12.0 prompt-toolkit==2.0.9 py==1.8.0 Pygments==2.4.2 pylint==2.3.1 pyparsing==2.4.2 pyrsistent==0.14.11 pytest==5.0.1 pytest-pylint==0.14.1 python-dateutil==2.8.0 pytz==2019.1 PyYAML==5.1.2 pyzmq==18.0.0 scipy==1.3.0 seaborn==0.9.0 six==1.12.0 testpath==0.4.2 toolz==0.10.0 tornado==6.0.3 traitlets==4.3.2 typed-ast==1.4.0 wcwidth==0.1.7 webencodings==0.5.1 wincertstore==0.2 wrapt==1.11.2 xlrd==1.2.0 zipp==0.5.2```
Thanks for any help. </denchmark-code>

comments.comment: There is a related issue here: <denchmark-link:https://github.com/pandas-profiling/pandas-profiling/issues/228>#228</denchmark-link> . Please let us know if this solution works for you or that we need to dig deeper.
is there a solution to this issue?
Restarting environment fixed the error for me. (Restart Jupyter notebook)

Thanks you
I tried restarting the environment but it hasn't worked for me <denchmark-link:#>…</denchmark-link>
On Mon, Sep 28, 2020 at 4:27 PM sakthigeek ***@***.***> wrote: Restarting environment fixed the error for me.
